titles.title: A bill to authorize a study on wetlands to commemorate the nationally significant contributions of Georgia O'Keeffe.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Interior Department, OMB.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Interior Department, OMB.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Measure incorporated into measure S. 2545 ordered to be reported.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 100-574.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1038.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 10/19/1988--Indefinitely postponed in Senate. (Measure indefinitely postponed in Senate) Authorizes and directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of the most appropriate way to interpret the impact of Georgia O'Keeffe on the world of art, including the feasibility of establishing a landscape museum. Requires the study to be completed and transmitted to the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate within one year of the date on which funds are appropriated for the study. Authorizes appropriations.
